H0.text: On September 28th, NASA announced that what had been detected on Mars. Liquid Methane

H1.text: On September 28th, NASA announced that what had been detected on Mars. Geysers

H2.text: On September 28th, NASA announced that what had been detected on Mars. Organic Molecules

H3.text: On September 28th, NASA announced that what had been detected on Mars. Flowing WATER

A4.text: The results showed an atmospheric pressure less than 1% of Earth's at sea level, effectively precluding the existence of liquid water, which would rapidly boil or freeze at such low pressures.

A5.text: The leading hypothesis involves the flow of brines (very salty water).

A6.text: The RSL do not flow onto shallower than 27 degree slopes, which is inconsistent with models for water.

A7.text: Seasonal flows on warm Martian slopes.

A8.text: Characteristics of the numerous and widespread recurring slope lineae (RSL) in Valles Marineris, Mars.
